Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and clean..”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 4 nights at this hotel, and was very impressed with what they are able to offer for the price. Booked through venere.com, who seem to have good prices. The hotel was spotlessly clean, my room was comfortable and a decent, and service was friendly (although nobody there after midday, maybe that's because of the season, although there was somone there to check me in on the day I arrived at 6pm). Reasonably good and plentiful breakfast. I found the hotel a little hard to find on arrival, I don't really understand the Venetian address system, and the directions are not that clear. But it's only 2 minutes from the S Marcuola Vaporetto stop, and very convenient for getting around the city (also for the Vaporetto stop for Murano and Burano). Lots of good, reasonably priced-trattorias and osterias in the area too. I'll defnitely go back to the Herion if I ever get to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Locanda Herion before a cruise from Venice. We have stayed there twice before. It is great for combining convenience and price. The rooms have always been very clean. It isn't fancy, but entirely adequate in this high priced city. By taking the vaporetto when we arrived to the Marcouli stop, we reached the hotel in 5 minutes. Breakfast was very good and the staff is most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good little B&B in a great location. Very detailed, honest review”
Reviews.Author: Adamnich
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a proper hotel with a big entrance hall and a bell boy then this isn't for you. If you are looking for a small B&B style hotel that is in a great location, with friendly staff at a good price then read on... If you are like me then you'd be planning on using your time in Venice outside not in your room looking for peeling wallpaper and bits of mold. Yes this isn't the most spotless hotel in the world but Venice old and is built on water. Therefore you can expect a bit of mold here and there. Location - the hotel is located just of the main thoroughfare from the station area (Ferrovia) up towards Cannaregio. It's 10 mins tops walk. It's not hard to find if you use your eyes. There's a sign on the wall when you need to turn off and then the hotel is just there. Although its off a bustling area, our hotel room, on the nearest side to the street was not at all noisy. However, some Italian guests did like the sound of their own voices. Hotel - the lady who runs the place was nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. The shower was lovely and powerful and hot. Breakfast offered cereal, bread, croissants, coffee, juice, yoghurt, pÃ¢tÃ©, honey, chocolate spread. There was a quite balcony on the inner side of the room which was nice for a pre-evening drink before heading out. If you do decide to use the vapporetti (water bus), NO ONE CHECKS TICKETS. We spent over 130 euros between 4 people and used it contstantly for 4 days without a single check. Your choice obviously.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a two stars hotel.”
Reviews.Author: klausen45
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find this is a nice, small hotel not far from the railway station. Rooms are clean and pleasant. Breakfast (the bread) is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, overpriced, but expected for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Seira77
Reviews.Content: We had no idea the film festival was in town when we visited, so we had a hard time to find a hotel. We had to settle with this one, very overpriced and tired little hotel. I read reviews about being hard to find and took directions and maps and even we had a hard time. And the problem is that there is NO sign, so it looks like a house from the outside. Be aware that the hotel has no receptionist from about 9pm to 7am. We got in at 4am and had to wander the streets with luggage until they showed up. But, when they did they let us get into our room right away, so that was great and much appreciated after a long train ride from Vienna. The room was "ok", but would definitely try to stay elsewhere if we go back to Venice, it was way overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: steve1289
Reviews.Content: The staff was good and helpful with requests. It is about a 10 minute walk from the train station and about a three minute walk to a water bus pick-up and drop off location. Also very close to a main street with shopping, restaurants, and a grocery store. The hotel is, however, located far away from the main locations. Good room with a good continental breakfast. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_girl_11
Reviews.Content: Only a few minutes from train station. Wifi available in reception area. Kind of pricey for the value but I'm not sure it that's because it was on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home... only better”
Reviews.Author: kak1221
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station (5-10) minute walk, hard to find, but well worth it. Anna and her brother have done a remarkable job in this 17 room bed and breakfast. It is literally about a block or so to the Grand canal and to the vaporetto stop off the main drag in the Cannareggio. Our room was large and the bath was too, beds were very comfortable and it was nice and quiet and the air conditioning was such a relief. We also really enjoyed the terraces in the mornings for breakfast and before and after dinner. Anna and her assistant were so accommodating and informative. We found some wonderful little restaurants (affordable) at their suggestions. They gave us insights on what not to miss in the Cannaregio and other parts of Venice including the islands of the lagoon. I would love to say I have another trip to Venice scheduled so we could stay again, but it will have to wait. I can guarantee you it will be for more than 5 days and we will be staying with Anna.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: LANewsboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days in early July, 2011, and had a perfectly fine time. Maybe the owners are reading TripAdvisor, because our room was spotlessly clean. It was very quiet, at the back of the hotel, and had a little balcony down the short hallway. The breakfast was simple but just fine to get the day started. Anna, and the folks who help her run the place, could not have been more helpful and sweet. One morning, when the coffee machine went on the blink, Anna made espresso for everyone. And it's an easy 5-minute walk to the vaporato stop, maybe mins to the bus and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Herion, tired and seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Tyrolia-Joe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy. We booked the hotel as a lower end, economy option. The idea is it was a sleeping place for 2 nights in Venice. The location is not bad, it's about a 10 - 15 minute walk from the train station. Sadly it doesn't make up for the somewhat dishevelled look of the accommodations. The cost is around 130 Euro /w breakfast, We had 2 rooms booked, both rooms on the second floor looked over a rather untidy court yard from a fairly dirty balcony. Both bathrooms had mould on the walls one rather a lot I thought. I'd avoid it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but very dirty rooms. Stay away”
Reviews.Author: bogotanikita
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this b&b and it fell well under expectations and they were so low! I was looking for a clean place to sleep and it was not clean at all. All the walls had mosquitoes "corpses" all over because the place was infested with them. Do not expect people at the front desk at all times or on a regular schedule, because they just come and go. I only saw someone at the moment of check-in and basically left my key on their desk. Wi-fi is free but you need to be able to find someone to give you a user id and password for two hours. The address on the website was wrong and it took quite a while to find the place because there's no visible sign. Location is ok, not really on cannaregio but on a small street near San Marcuola station. Walking from the train station you have to carry your luggage over a big bridge but this is normal for Venice so I suggest taking the airborne bus. Overall not a good experience so you better stay away from this b&b

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lpoc
Reviews.Content: What a great little Hotel. Friendly staff and a beautiful room. Right in a great location in the middle of Venice. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristiina83
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel even though the breakfast was quite poor, but we were prepared when we chose this hotel so we weren't even disappointed. Hotel was small and charming. The staff was very friendly and our room was fantastic! Also the bed was the most comfortable ever! We'd definitely go back! Location was convenient because it was close to the railway station and water taxis were also nearby. St. Marc's Square was about 20 minutes away if you want to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “The real Venice and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: margueriteOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Herion for 2 nights prior to leaving for a cruise from Venice. The hotel was excellent - near the train station and Piazzole Roma (and away from San Marco Square and all the tourists). The breakfast was wonderful and the bedroom was large. It is very quiet . It is in Canarregio - which is a real neighbourhood - lots of restaurants and shops , a real local food market, and a much less touristy feeling . Ask them to email directions. Although you have to walk up a flight of stairs - the staff are there and very willing to be of help with maps and directions and suggestions. Get a IMOB pass for the vaporettos and go to LIDO, Murano and Giudecca.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Missmardy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Herion for 3 nights in October this year. We chose it from the reviews on Tripadvisor and because it was on of the few remotely affordable hotels we could find. Despite it being a bit difficult to find (we arrived at night in the pouring rain) it is a lovely little hotel. The staff are really helpful and speak very good english. Our room was a standard double decorated in classic italian sparse decour but very stylish and there was a lovely big bathroom with a nice shower. The hotel is very small and has a lovely indoor terrace area which Im sure which be lovely in the Summer. The only downsides are that there are no real communal space to relax in and the breakfast is very basic (croissant and tea or coffee from a machine). The location is the best thing about this hotel though, it is 5 minutes walk from the Guglie Vaporetto stop which takes you to the airport in 35 minutes and into the main part of Venice in minutes. You can walk everywhere easily from here and the Canneregio area itself is really nice and less touristy than other parts we saw. I would happily recommend this hotel and Venice, just remember to take comfy shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandN2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, Great location, very close to train station. But most importantly the room was larger and nice than any other hotels we stayed before! Bathroom was clean and large. The guy there is very friendly. Overall, i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel. Great service, location, and room.”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler99
Reviews.Content: The guy who works here is incredibly nice. The room was very comfortable, and the breakfast was the best I had in my 3 weeks in Italy. It's also served on a nice patio. No refrigerator, and the volume on the tv is set so low that you can't hear it, but otherwise this hotel was perfect. I'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: JoJoG5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the train station, so it is a convenient walk for our one-night stay. You have to look for the tiny sign on the side of a building pointing to the right, as the hotel entrance is behind the building that faces the main street. The clerk was very attentive, carried our bags upstairs, and was very helpful. He showed us how to use the air conditioner and opened breakfast early just for us when we had an early train to catch. He deserves an A+ for excellent service. Breakfast was nice and a terrace is available when the weather is nice. The room was very large with a king-sized bed and a twin bed. It had a chandelier and elegant ceiling paintings. The only problem we noted was quite a bit of mildew and mold in the shower and bathroom. The room was very quiet and comfortable and had a tv and a wardrobe for clothes. We never heard any other guests or any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: DaySpaz
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay... located in a nice part of Venice where we felt very safe. The room we stayed in was clean and very well maintained. The room has real air conditioning with morn insulated windows, so no major noice and a confortable night sleep. The only problem was the directions to find the hotel. Get off at the Guglia stop.... walk towards the bridge that crosses the canal... turn left on Conneregio... walk until you see a small copper colored plaque that says Locanda Herion loacted on the right side of the street about 10 feet up on the corner of a building... turn right down that street and you're there... Clean with nice people... what more can you really ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: lifesapitch22
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Venice for the weekend and arrived around midnight. The guy there did not speak English, but was pleasant and signed us in. He showed us to our room, then after we settled in, he realized he gave us the wrong room and took us to another, bigger room. So, not a big deal. The owner the next morning was very pleasant (and spoke English) and apologized for the mix up. At check-out he even gave us back some $ because we were still in the wrong room! Overall, I would say this hotel is perfect for a quick getaway. The room was clean, the bathroom was very clean (which I value most), the staff were friendly, and the location is in a pretty quiet spot, which makes for a good night sleep. We were able to leave our bags at the front after we checked out to do some more sightseeing before we left. On Sundays, no one works there, so you are able to get a key to the front door to get in. I will definitely stay there again if I go back to Venice. The owner said you might get a discount by booking directly with them particularly during the summer. So ask!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel for A Few Nights Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tugb0at
Reviews.Content: The service was very friendly and helpful. Fiding the hotel is a bit tricky, but so is finding any place in Venice. Trust me, you'll know once you've been there! :) The location is excellent: we came by train and left by train. There is a 10-20 minute walk to the train station and the bus station (where you can take the Fly bus which takes 20 minutes to the airport) and a few minutes walk to the water transport. Since the Cannareggio area is not so much filled with tourists as for example the San Marco area, the atmoshere is more relaxed and you get to see real venetian life is you go about wondering the small streets. Although the hotel is very close to the Cannareggios busiest street, the room was very quiet! The room was good: air conditioning, lots of space and light and a big bathroom. No safety deposit or fridge in the room, though. We really liked the big bathroom and especially enjoyed the pittoresque courtyard where you could have your breakfast. The quality of the room and the fascilities corresponded very well to the price of the night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay close to public transport access (water buses, taxis, train station and transportation to the airport) but still would like to avoid tourist masses. Thank you Locanda Herion, for a lovely two night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sandura
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night in April 09. The hotel is small but the room is clean & spacious with spacious bathroom. The most important thing its SUPER clean and very nice and very helpful staff. The only thing that we didn't like is the breakfast is poor. But for the money we paid its worth it! Thank You Locanda for the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at good position”
Reviews.Author: EUHR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in very good place, just few minutes by foot from Train station. Hotel is clean, rooms are nice, hotel stuff are very helpfull and nice. It was big suprised because hotels in Italy are known as not very clean and good, especcially for hotel with just 2 stars like this one. But this hotel is oposite of Italian hotels. Its decor in typical vencian style, and has very nice garden if you want to have breakfast outside. I would recomend this hotel for staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tourist48
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at this hotel. We booked well in advance to get a good price, and payed about 105 Euro/night. It is about 10 mins walk from the train station and relatively easy to find. Be warned though...everywhere in Venice you must pay for maps, about 2.50 Euro. If you can find some for free then get as many as you can! We had a large double room, with ensuite which was clean, tidy and comfortable. It had AC which is absolutely necessary in summer! The breakfast was just lovely, traditional European style, in a small courtyard that adjoins the hotel. The best part for us was the staff at Locanda Herion. We found after a week in Italy that Italians can be very rude and have poor customer service, especially in touristy places. The manager bent over backwards for us, and let us keep our bags there on the final day with no problems. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to English speakers who want comfort and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “At the Station end of Town.”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted17
Reviews.Content: We liked the Locanda Herion. The location on a main shopping street in a more "workaday" part of Venice just adds to the charm (& the noise). Remember that you're in a living city here & not in the countryside! Finding the hotel & the entrance is a bit of a lark. Once in, the hotel is rather charming even if the young staff are sometimes a little curt and/or dim (not unusual for Venice!). Our room was very large and had one of those traditional mosaic floors. The bed was good and large and the bathroom was very good. The view from the room was of the internal courtyard an other rooftops. Breakfast was served in the hotel (but I understand that this is not always the case), it wasn't up to much - just the excuse for coffeee, grappa & a croissant in a bar at 10:30! Water bus stop fairly close - San Marcuola. Value? pretty good for the type of room - this reflects the less glamorous location I think. Would we go back? Probably not, we prefer to pay a little more now & go to the fancy end of town!

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you have a real bed.”
Reviews.Author: cmd123
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that our experience here was not typical. I had spent ages researching hotels in Venice, and given the cost and availability in high season, I was satisfied that this was a good choice. We paid â‚¬450 for 3 nights. Our room (#9), which was booked months in advance, was very small and our bed was a fold-out couch. We looked in other rooms and saw that they were much more spacious and had real beds. In one room, you entered into a sitting room, went up a few stone steps to the bedroom and down a few to the bath. Very cool. Our bathroom was very (very!) small but plumbing was good and there was plenty of hot water. The room had heat and A/C. However, when I look at the hotel photos provided on this website (via Venere) it looks nothing like the hotel we stayed in. There is no restaurant or bar that I saw, just the breakfast room. The room photos make me jealous! We liked the location in Cannaregio a lot--a real neighborhood, with small restaurants, shops, and personality. A 25 minute walk from the hoards of tourists in St. Marco Square, minutes from the S. Marcuola vaporetto stop and an easy walk even with luggage from the train station and the Guglie stop on the Alilaguna water bus (which is a great way to get in from the airport). Breakfast was good and was served al fresco on a patio. The staff, especially Anna, was excellent. If we had had a real bed, we would rate this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Deece
Reviews.Content: went with couple of friends, our room was big (two floors), bathroom was brand new and huge. the extra bed was an actual bed, no sofa bed. they seem to have done some remodeling. the entrance/reception was new, also the entrance was moved to the main street. front desk staff very friendly, kept our luggage at the reception, no luggage room as is typical with these bed & breakfasts. breakfast was good enough, yes mostly was prepacked but varied. for their rate, yes I would return, have seen lot worse in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Qtpi_e_7
Reviews.Content: A room at the Locanda Herion was unexpected...we originally booked a room at Hotel Tintoretto also in the Cannaregio district however due to "plumbing" problems, we were placed at Locanda. The hotel served our basic needs well: a double bed, a/c (very cold), a private bathroom, and a quick breakfast. We left our bags and confirmed our reservation at 12 p.m. with the receptionist and only returned after 11 p.m...our bags stayed in the lobby. We checked out at 9 a.m., so our stay was short. Breakfast was nothing special, but served the necessities of caffeine, starch, yogurt and Nutella. Note: we walked from San Lucia train station with backpacks. It was approximately 15 minutes. The hotel is across from a florist and has a glass door with a signing hanging above.

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Herion
HotelInfo.Address: Cannareggio 1704, 30121 Venice, Italy
